poem:
**Bill After Foster**

Out of foster's clasp,  
a flat I call my own. 

Fifty pounds—  
a shield against the cold.  

Now EDF's paper thunder  
echoes—a £2,700 storm—  
unasked for, sudden.

Youth's promise cracked,  
yet beneath such weight,  
hope flickers—  
to navigate night's  
unexpected demand.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "EDF sent me a £2,700 bill in my first home after foster care I am living in my first home since coming out of foster care. I moved into the flat in 2020, and topped up my credit meter with £50 a month, as instructed by my housing association. I understood that this covered my gas and electricity use. In 2023, I received a demand for more than £2,700 from EDF, stating that I had". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
